Package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.eclipse.xml

Class ConfigReader

java.lang.Object
de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.eclipse.xml.ConfigReader
public class ConfigReader
extends Object
This class reads a config file for Eclipse code formatter.
Author:
bahlef

    • toFileObject

      public static FileObject toFileObject​(String filePath) throws IOException
      Creates a FileObject from the given filePath and returns it.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to a file which should be turned into a FileObject
      Returns:
      a FileObject representing the given filePath
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O issue while trying to access the given filePath

    • toFileObject

      public static FileObject toFileObject​(File file) throws IOException
      Creates a FileObject from the given File and returns it.
      Parameters:
      file - the File which should be turned into a FileObject
      Returns:
      a FileObject representing the given File
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O issue while trying to access the given File

    • getProfileSettings

      @NonNull public static Map<String,​String> getProfileSettings​(FileObject fileObject, String profileName) throws ConfigReadException, ProfileNotFoundException, IOException, SAXException
      Parses and returns the key/value pairs from the given FileObject for the given profileName as a Map.
      Parameters:
      fileObject - the FileObject to parse
      profileName - the profile name for which to get the settings
      Returns:
      a Map within all the configuration paramters of the given profileName read from the given FileObject, or throws an exception if there's a problem reading the input, e.g.: invalid XML.
      Throws:
      SAXException - if there are parsing issues
      IOException - if there is an I/O issue
      ConfigReadException - if the given FileObject is not a valid Eclipse formatter template
      ProfileNotFoundException - if no profile could be found with the given profileName in the given FileObject

    • getProfileNames

      @NonNull public static List<String> getProfileNames​(FileObject fileObject) throws ConfigReadException, IOException, SAXException
      Parses the given FileObject and returns a List within all profile names found in that FileObject.
      Parameters:
      fileObject - the FileObject to parse
      Returns:
      a List within all profile names found in the given FileObject
      Throws:
      SAXException - if there are parsing issues
      IOException - if there is an I/O issue
      ConfigReadException - if the given FileObject is not a valid Eclipse formatter template
